intro: Lastrea agatholepis, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually basal, fleshy, and sometimes covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its resilience in harsh conditions.
